newsitem.title: PERU: Peru says halved $360 mln debt with U.S. gov't.
newsitem.headline: Peru says halved $360 mln debt with U.S. gov't.

text.p: Peruvian officials said Friday Economy Minister Jorge Camet had signed an accord with U.S. ambassador Dennis Jett allowing Peru to halve its $360 million "concessional" debt with the U.S. Agency for International Development (AID).
A U.S. Embassy statement added that Peru was "the first country to accede to a program of debt reduction of this sort, within the framework of the new law approved by the U.S. government."
It added that "the advantageous terms offered to Peru through this accord reflect the U.S. government's acknowledgement of the successful implementation of market-based economic reforms."
The agreement was signed as part of Peru's negotiations with members of the Paris Club of creditor nations.
"The reduction will be carried out through buy-back and/or debt-conversion operations," the embassy statement added.
